label: 密陀絵
本: Exhibition of Shōsō-in Treasures , The 52nd  . Nara National Museum . 2000
説明文: On lacquer, it refers to designs painted with a paste made from pigments mixed with perilla or linseed oil that has been boiled together with lead monoxide. This term also encompasses the technique of applying an overall coating of oil to a painting executed in pigments mixed with animal-skin glue.
